intro: Stathmostelma angustatum subsp. angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stathmostelma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky areas. This subspecies is notable for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
